AI Awareness: Updates That Matter ✨️
OpenAI Loses Top Talent in the AI Wars. Can It Survive the Zuck-pocalyse?
| AI For Humans | July 3, 2025
OpenAI, Meta & Google are fighting over who gets to control the future of superintelligence but what happens when Zuck robs Sam Altman blind? And is Apple about to onboard Anthropic? And will that fix Siri? PLS?!

News 📰️
1.)
Top 5 Most Clicked News Articles From Last Week
A.)
Apple’s AI Siri Might Be Powered By OpenAI
| TheVerge.com | June 30, 2025
Apple is exploring the possibility of enhancing Siri with external AI technologies, specifically from OpenAI or Anthropic, as the company seeks to improve its AI functionalities. Struggling to develop an upgraded Siri, Apple has begun testing third-party large-language models in its private cloud infrastructure.
B.)
“CheatGPT” Is Breaking Education
| TheNeuronDaily.com | June 30, 2025
The emergence of AI tools like ChatGPT has triggered chaos in the educational landscape, with a significant percentage of college students utilizing such technologies for assignments. Schools are grappling with the challenges posed by AI, leading to inconsistent policies and pushing for innovative educational models that incorporate AI into learning.
C.)
‘Hey Man, I’m So Sorry For Your Loss’: Should You Use AI To Text?
| TheGuardian.com | June 30, 2025
The rise of AI in personal communications raises questions about authenticity and emotional connections, as many people are now using AI tools to craft heartfelt messages. While some argue that AI can enhance communication by assisting with emotional expression, others feel it detracts from the genuineness of human interactions and may even erode relationships.
D.)
101 Ways To Use AI In Your Daily Life
| Tina Huang | YouTube.com | June 29, 2025
Explore a plethora of practical applications for AI that can significantly enhance productivity and lifestyle. From general productivity to personal finance management, discover how these AI-driven tools can transform daily tasks and improve overall efficiency.
E.)
LLM’s Are Optimizing The Adult Industry
| TheVerge.com | June 30, 2025
The transition from traditional adult entertainment studios to platforms like OnlyFans has led performers to take on multiple roles, including marketing and customer interaction. Many creators are now leveraging AI tools to streamline their workflows, cope with the demands of fan engagement, and optimize content production, although perspectives on AI’s role in this industry vary among entertainers.
July 8, 2025 📅️
2.)
Sponsorship Packages Available
| AI-Weekly.ai | July 8, 2025
Would your product, service or message benefit from reaching over
45,000
AI subscribers each week? For just $200 USD / month? If you’re thinking yes, we invite you to try a

3.)
One Time Advertisements Available
| AI-Weekly.ai | July 8, 2025
One time advertisements are available to anyone, with or without a Sponsorship. Would your product, service or message benefit from reaching over
45,000
AI subscribers? If you’re thinking yes, we invite you to check out our
one time advertising options
. They are cost-effective, targeted and
measurable
. Scheduling is optional.
Learn more
today.
4.)
Do You Have A Link In This Issue? Learn How To Track It For Free
| AI-Weekly.ai | July 8, 2025
This article outlines, step-by-step, how you can get free website traffic reporting on any link to your domain (AKA domain name, website or web address) that has been published by AI-Weekly.
July 7, 2025 📅️
5.)
The AI Invasion Of YouTube (And Hollywood) Has Begun…
| TheNeuronDaily.com | July 7, 2025
The job market is witnessing unusual trends as companies focus on increasing productivity through AI tools rather than hiring new employees. Meanwhile, an AI-generated animated series, Cat Biggie, is set to premiere on YouTube, exemplifying the significant penetration of AI in the entertainment industry.
6.)
xAI Updated Grok To Be More ‘Politically Incorrect’
| Verge.com | July 7, 2025
Elon Musk’s xAI has updated its chatbot Grok, instructing it to adopt more subjective viewpoints and make politically incorrect claims. This modification follows Grok’s controversial comments regarding media bias and has sparked discussions about the ethical implications of AI responding in such a manner.
7.)
New AI Tools For Mental Health Research And Treatment
| Blog.Google | July 7, 2025
Google announces the launch of two new initiatives aimed at enhancing mental health treatment through AI. These include a practical field guide for organizations on utilizing AI in mental health interventions and a multi-year investment in AI research to develop better treatment methods for anxiety, depression, and psychosis.
8.)
Tennis Players Criticize AI Technology Used By Wimbledon
| TechCrunch.com | July 7, 2025
Some tennis players are unhappy with the implementation of AI line judges at Wimbledon, citing inaccuracies that led to critical match disruptions. Players like Emma Raducanu and Jack Draper voiced concerns about the technology’s reliability, while an incident occurred where the AI failed to call an out ball, prompting an official human intervention. Wimbledon organizers are facing backlash as they adjust their automated systems amidst ongoing critiques.
July 5, 2025 📅️
9.)
This AI Band Went Viral — Here’s How They Did It!
| Matt Wolfe | YouTube.com | July 5, 2025
Delve into the rise of Spotify’s innovative AI Band, exploring its unique sound and significance in the evolving landscape of music. Learn how to create your own AI music and album art, while navigating the process to release your tracks on Spotify.
10.)
Almost Timely News: Generative AI Use Cases In PR
| Chris Penn | YouTube.com | July 5, 2025
Explore how generative AI can elevate public relations strategies through seven key applications. Gain insights into transforming content creation into strategic initiatives and learn innovative techniques for crafting personalized client communications that deliver exceptional outcomes.
July 4, 2025 📅️
11.)
What Perplexity Labs Actually Does (+ Best Ways to use)
| Grace Leung | YouTube.com | July 4, 2025
Perplexity Labs introduces an innovative feature that differs significantly from Deep Research, offering new solutions for business and marketing workflows. Key insights focus on its applications, limitations, and strategic use cases such as competitor intelligence and social media trend tracking.
12.)
GTA AI Is Here & WILD! (And You Can Play It!)
| Theoretically Media | YouTube.com | July 4, 2025
Explore the revolutionary advancements in gaming with the introduction of AI-generated worlds in ‘Mirage,’ a game that allows players to generate their adventures in real-time using text prompts. Delve into the mind-blowing capabilities of this new technology and what it means for the future of interactive entertainment.
July 3, 2025 📅️
13.)
Why We Don’t Talk About AGI Anymore…
| TheNeuronDaily.com | July 3, 2025
The conversation around artificial general intelligence (AGI) has shifted sharply towards superintelligence, with major companies racing to achieve it by 2027. This shift raises questions about whether AGI has been achieved in secret or if the definitions are being rebranded, leaving the AI community in a state of uncertainty.
14.)
Podcast: Can You Run DeepSeek On Your Laptop?
| TheNeuronDaily.com | July 3, 2025
This podcast episode delves into the implications of running the open-source AI model DeepSeek on personal laptops, discussing its potential and hardware requirements. Experts Grant and Corey highlight the significant challenges, including the model’s high resource consumption, inspired by DeepSeek’s rise and impact on the tech market.
15.)
AI Helps Couple Conceive After 18-Year Struggle With Infertility | Cnn
| CNN.com | July 3, 2025
After trying to conceive for 18 years, one couple is now pregnant with their first child thanks to the power of artificial intelligence.
16.)
Sakana AI’s Treequest Boosts Llm Performance By 30% Using Multi-Model Collaboration
| VentureBeat.com | July 3, 2025
Japanese AI lab Sakana AI has introduced a new technique that allows multiple large language models (LLMs) to cooperate on a single task, effectively creating a “dream team” of AI agents. The method, called Multi-LLM AB-MCTS, enables models to perform trial-and-error and combine their unique strengths to solve problems that are too complex for any individual model.
17.)
Safe Superintelligence Ceo Daniel Gross Joins Meta’s New AI Research Lab
| SiliconAngle.com | July 3, 2025
Meta Platforms Inc. has hired prominent artificial intelligence executive Daniel Gross and may reportedly buy a stake in his venture capital firm.
18.)
Ilya Sutskever Named CEO Of Safe Superintelligence After Daniel Gross Steps Down
| TechCrunch.com | July 3, 2025
OpenAI co-founder Ilya Sutskever says he is stepping into the CEO role at Safe Superintelligence, the AI startup he launched in 2024. In a post on X, Sutskever confirmed Thursday that Daniel Gross, the startup’s co-founder and CEO, departed the company as of June 29. Safe Superintelligence co-founder Daniel Levy is becoming president of the startup, according to Sutskever.
19.)
Meta Tests Proactive Chatbots That Message Users First To Boost Engagement
| TechCrunch.com | July 3, 2025
Imagine you’re messaging some friends on the Facebook Messenger app or WhatsApp, and you get an unsolicited message from an AI chatbot that’s obsessed with films.
July 2, 2025 📅️
20.)
Cloudflare Says AI’s Free Lunch Is Over
| TheNeuronDaily.com | July 2, 2025
Cloudflare is launching a system to make AI bots pay for access to content, allowing publishers to set fees for their websites. This initiative aims to help creators monetize their work amid a significant increase in AI crawler traffic, transforming content into a valuable asset in an AI-driven future.
21.)
27 Free Things You Can Do With Gemini
| Matt Wolfe | YouTube.com | July 2, 2025
Explore the myriad of free features offered by Google Gemini and discover how to enhance your creative and productivity projects. A range of tools and prompts allow users to create graphics, develop apps, and even produce podcasts, showcasing the platform’s versatility in a digital age.
22.)
Aaron Levie: White Collar Jobs, Future of SaaS, Agents, Concentration of Power
| Matt Berman | YouTube.com | July 2, 2025
Aaron Levie explores the evolving landscape of white-collar jobs and the future of Software as a Service (SaaS), addressing concerns around AI integration, the concentration of power in tech companies, and the implications of personal versus work agents. Insights into managing AI and its potential impact on workplaces are also shared, alongside reflections on the future of the web.
23.)
Can Your Laptop Handle DeepSeek, or Do You Need A Supercomputer?
| The Neuron | YouTube.com | July 2, 2025
Corey Noles and Grant Harvey delve into the implications of DeepSeek, the controversial AI that has shaken the tech landscape. They analyze system requirements for running advanced models, the potential security risks associated with their use, and present safer alternatives for exploring open-source AI solutions.
24.)
Get Advice on Using Anthropic’s Claude in Our ‘Chatbot Basics’ Subscriber-Only Livestream Replay
| Wired.com | July 2, 2025
A livestream replay hosted by Reece Rogers and Kylie Robison discusses the features of Anthropic’s Claude chatbot, comparing it with OpenAI’s ChatGPT. The session covers topics such as privacy considerations, the software’s response personalities, and user experiences while interacting with Claude, providing insights for users exploring chatbot technology.
25.)
What Could A Healthy AI Companion Look Like?
| Wired.com | July 2, 2025
Portola’s Tolan is a unique chatbot designed to foster healthy human-AI relationships by avoiding anthropomorphism and discouraging unhealthy dependencies. Unlike traditional chatbots, Tolans encourage users to engage in real-life activities and relationships, while providing emotional support without romantic or sexual interactions.
26.)
GeminiApp Launches Veo 3 Globally For Pro Members With Daily Video Generations
| X.com | July 2, 2025
The wait is over. @GeminiApp is now shipping Veo 3 *globally* for all Pro members! That means India, Indonesia, all of Europe, and more are starting to get access to create videos right now. As a member, you’ll get 3 video generations per day, and that credit will replenish daily.
27.)
ChatGPT Referrals To News Sites Rise, But Can’t Offset Declining Search Traffic: TechCrunch
| TechCrunch.com | July 2, 2025
Referrals from ChatGPT to news publishers are growing, but not enough to counter the decline in clicks resulting from users increasingly getting their news directly from AI or AI-powered search results, according to a report from digital market intelligence company Similarweb.
28.)
Grammarly Launches Free Tool To Verify If Writing Is AI-Generated
| ZDNet.com | July 2, 2025
If you use Google Docs or MS Office and Grammarly, there’s a new feature that could be of assistance. That feature is called Track Your Work, and it’s now built right into Grammarly. Even better, the feature is available in the free Grammarly account.
29.)
Baidu Launches AI Video Generator And Upgrades Search Engine
| Reuters.com | July 2, 2025
China’s Baidu on Wednesday launched an AI-driven video generator for businesses as well as a major upgrade to its search engine.
The image-to-video model, called MuseSteamer, is capable of generating videos up to 10 seconds long and comes in three versions – Turbo, Pro and Lite.
30.)
OpenAI Condemns Robinhood’s Unauthorized Sale Of OpenAI Tokens
| TechCrunch.com | July 2, 2025
OpenAI wants to make clear that Robinhood’s sale of “OpenAI tokens” will not give everyday consumers equity — or stock — in OpenAI, the company said in a post from its official newsroom account on X. OpenAI says it does not endorse Robinhood’s effort, nor was it involved in facilitating the token sale.
31.)
Nvidia RTX AI Boosts Black Forest Labs’ Flux.1 Kontext Image Model
| Blogs.nvidia.com | July 2, 2025
NVIDIA RTX and TensorRT speed up Black Forest Labs’ latest image generation and editing model; plus, Gemma 3n is now accelerated by RTX and NVIDIA Jetson, and the G-Assist Plug-In Hackathon continues.
32.)
The Guardian: AI Raises Copyright Concerns For Artists Like Eminem, Calls For New Digital Laws
| TheGuardian.com | July 2, 2025
I can’t quote a single line from a song in my book. So how can big tech legally feast on all the lyrics ever written?
July 1, 2025 📅️
33.)
Microsoft AI Beats Doctors
| TheNeuronDaily.com | July 1, 2025
Microsoft’s new AI tool, MAI-DxO, has achieved a breakthrough in medical diagnostics, correctly diagnosing 85.5% of complex cases that stumped expert physicians. This innovation suggests that AI could revolutionize healthcare economics by improving diagnostic accuracy while reducing unnecessary testing costs.
34.)
Inside ChatGPT, AI Assistants, And Building At OpenAI — The OpenAI Podcast Ep. 2
| OpenAI | YouTube.com | July 1, 2025
Nick Turley and Mark Chen delve into the factors behind ChatGPT’s unexpected success and examine the complexities of reasoning within AI systems. Their conversation explores the future of AI development, addressing challenges in agentic coding and the evolution of multimodal assistants.
35.)
The Correct Way To Use ChatGPT (In 2025)
| Jeff Su | YouTube.com | July 1, 2025
Gain insights into maximizing your ChatGPT experience with practical applications for current reasoning models, web search, and advanced features. This guide breaks down essential strategies for effective use, enabling learners to harness the power of AI tools for their projects.
36.)
What’s Actually Coming in AI (From Someone Building It)
| The Next Wave | YouTube.com | July 1, 2025
Matt Wolfe engages with DJ Sampath, a leader in AI products at Cisco, exploring the imminent advancements in artificial intelligence that promise to revolutionize networking and enterprise architecture. Delving into Cisco’s AI Canvas platform, they discuss the intersection of AI and everyday infrastructure, emphasizing the transformative potential across various sectors and the emerging challenges in AI security.
37.)
OpenAI Stays With Nvidia, Holds Off On Google’s AI Chips
| BusinessToday.in | July 1, 2025
OpenAI has clarified that it has no active plans to use Google’s in-house artificial intelligence chips, known as Tensor Processing Units (TPUs), to power its products, despite recent reports suggesting otherwise.
38.)
Cloudflare To Block AI Chatbot Crawlers, Introduces Paywall Feature
| QZ.com | July 1, 2025
Cloudfare introduced a new feature that lets users charge fees to AI chatbot companies to crawl their sites.
39.)
Meta Adds Business Voice Calls To Whatsapp, Explores AI-Powered Voice Recommendations
| TechCrunch.com | July 1, 2025
WhatsApp is adding more AI features to its business suite. The company on Tuesday announced it’s introducing the ability for large businesses to reach customers through voice calls, which will allow the app to explore the use of AI-powered voice agents.
40.)
US Senate Removes Controversial AI Moratorium Provision From Budget Bill
| TechCrunch.com | July 1, 2025
U.S. senators voted overwhelmingly on Tuesday to remove a controversial 10-year ban on states’ abilities to regulate AI from the Trump administration’s “Big Beautiful Bill,” reports Axios.
41.)
Grammarly To Acquire Superhuman To Boost AI Productivity Platform
| BusinessWire.com | July 1, 2025
Email becomes central communication surface in company’s vision for agentic future where humans and AI work together.
42.)
X Now Allows AI Chatbots To Generate Community Notes
| AdWeek.com | July 1, 2025
X is piloting a new program that lets AI systems engage in the fact-checking process.
43.)
Google Uses Veo To Animate Iconic Harley-Davidson Museum Photography
| Blog.google | July 1, 2025
Moving Archives, a new program from Google Arts & Culture Lab, explores how Google AI can bring visual archives to life. For the first edition we’ve collaborated with the Harley-Davidson Museum, whose rich collection is a treasure trove for anyone interested in motorcycling, the history of this iconic American brand and even broader American culture and industry.
44.)
Wimbledon Replaces Line Judges With AI, Sparking Debate Among Players And Fans
| EuroNews.com | July 1, 2025
The suited line judges have been replaced by robots. Some argue it takes the theatrics out of the court and some players have reported difficulties with the tech.
45.)
ChatGPT Helps Reddit User Successfully Handle Persistent Online Harassment
| Reddit.com | July 1, 2025
ChatGPT helped me finally get rid of this weirdo who has been bothering me for months.
46.)
Perplexity Launches Perplexity Max To Enhance User Experience
| Perplexity.ai | July 1, 2025
Introducing Perplexity Max. Perplexity’s most powerful subscription tier yet. Perplexity Max is our most advanced subscription tier yet, built for those who demand limitless AI productivity and immediate access to the newest products and features from Perplexity. With Perplexity Max, you can reach the maximum power of your curiosity.
47.)
Amazon Unveils Deepfleet AI Model To Enhance Robotics Efficiency In Operations
| X.com | July 1, 2025
One of the why questions we’re always asking is how can we help operations employees access inventory more efficiently? We’re taking a big leap forward by introducing DeepFleet, an exciting new AI model that makes our one million+ robot fleet work smarter.
48.)
Premier League Introduces AI Intelligence Engine To Enhance Fan Experience
| Unlocked.microsoft.com | July 1, 2025
The Premier League is a global phenomenon, boasting 1.8 billion fans across every continent, culture, and language. The league is evolving to meet the needs of its global fans. At the heart of this transformation is Microsoft technology, bringing trusted cloud and AI innovation to transform how billions of fans globally engage with the league they love.
Last Week 📅️
49.)
Baidu Releases Ernie 4.5, An Open-Source Multimodal Model Family With Up To 424B Parameters
| Yiyan.baidu.com | June 30, 2025
We introduce ERNIE 4.5, a new family of large-scale multimodal models comprising 10 distinct variants. The model family consist of Mixture-of-Experts (MoE) models with 47B and 3B active parameters, with the largest model having 424B total parameters, as well as a 0.3B dense model. For the MoE architecture, we propose a novel heterogeneous modality structure, which supports parameter sharing across modalities while also allowing dedicated parameters for each individual modality.
50.)
Spotify Users Unknowingly Stream AI-Generated Band The Velvet Sundown
| ArsTechnica.com | June 30, 2025
Making art used to be a uniquely human endeavor, but machines have learned to distill human creativity with generative AI. Whether that content counts as “art” depends on who you ask, but Spotify doesn’t discriminate. A new band called The Velvet Sundown debuted on Spotify this month and has already amassed more than half a million listeners. But by all appearances, The Velvet Sundown is not a real band — it’s AI.
51.)
Apple’s Secret Vision Products Roadmap Revealed By Analyst Ming-Chi Kuo
| MacRumors.com | June 30, 2025
Apple analyst Ming-Chi Kuo has shared a detailed roadmap of the company’s Vision and smart glasses plans until the end of the decade.
52.)
Songscription Launches AI-Powered Sheet Music Transcription Tool
| TechCrunch.com | June 30, 2025
A small company called Songscription launched last week with AI models that automate music transcription, turning an audio file of a song into sheet music within minutes. Operating on a freemium model, the product is geared toward both professional and hobbyist musicians.
53.)
Apple Considers Anthropic Or OpenAI To Replace Siri’s In-House AI
| Bloomberg.com | June 30, 2025
Apple Inc. is considering using artificial intelligence technology from Anthropic PBC or OpenAI to power a new version of Siri, sidelining its own in-house models in a potentially blockbuster move aimed at turning around its flailing AI effort.
54.)
Google Expands Vids Access, Launches Free Gemini AI Tools For Classroom
| Blog.google | June 30, 2025
We’re expanding access to Google Vids to all Google Workspace for Education users and adding new AI features in Classroom.
55.)
Microsoft Explores AI’s Role In Advancing Medical Superintelligence
| Microsoft.ai | June 30, 2025
The Microsoft AI team shares research that demonstrates how AI can sequentially investigate and solve medicine’s most complex diagnostic challenges — cases that expert physicians struggle to answer.
56.)
Sakana AI Unveils AB-MCTS Algorithm For Enhanced AI Model Cooperation
| X.com | June 30, 2025
We’re excited to introduce AB-MCTS! Our new inference-time scaling algorithm enables collective intelligence for AI by allowing multiple frontier models (like Gemini 2.5 Pro, o4-mini, DeepSeek-R1-0528) to cooperate.
57.)
Meta Announces Superintelligence Initiative And Expanded AI Hiring Plans
| Bloomberg.com | June 30, 2025
Meta Platforms Inc. Chief Executive Officer Mark Zuckerberg announced a major restructuring of the company’s artificial intelligence group, including a commitment to developing AI “superintelligence,” or systems that can complete tasks as well as or even better than humans.
58.)
Cursor Launches AI Coding Assistant ‘Cursor Agent’ On Web And Mobile
| Cursor.com | June 30, 2025
You can now work with Cursor Agents on web and mobile. Just like the familiar agent that works alongside you in the IDE, agents on web and mobile can write code, answer complex questions, and scaffold out your work.
59.)
US Senate Reaches Deal To Pause State AI Regulations For Five Years
| Bloomberg.com | June 29, 2025
The Senate is poised to approve a controversial provision preventing some US states from regulating artificial intelligence, marking a victory for the tech companies, venture capital firms and startups that backed it.
